dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: INT. RITCHIE’S APARTMENT/LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Rain trickles down the window. A flash of lightning light the room. The couch is folded out into a bed. A BEAUTIFUL NAKED BLONDE is stretched out across it, asleep. RITCHIE BOLAND, late 30’s, not the biggest guy around, bu rock-solid, stands in the small kitchen a few feet away. His face is stuck in a permanent frown. He takes sips of his coffee and admires her from the counter. The sheets barely cover her moonlit curves. He walks over and tucks her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s pouring rain. Ritchie’s car squeezes between the buildings. Its headlights can barely make it through the downpour. INT. RITCHIE’S CAR - TRAVELING Ritchie drives. SAMMY “TWO-BALLS”, late 30’s, sits in the passenger seat. His skeletal features draped in shadow.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Look at this shit. What we do for money, eh Ritchie? Ritchie's eyes go to the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop.  INT. RITCHIE’S CAR Ritchie kills the engine. Sammy looks out at the rain.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie gets out. The rain is relentless. He’s soaked instantly. The lightning helps him inspect his surroundings. The buildings have their backs to him. He looks up at the fir escapes... nothing. INT. RITCHIE’S CAR Ritchie drops into his seat. He shakes off the cold rain. Some of it lands on Sammy.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Sorry, Sammy. Sammy pats the drops away. Ritchie blows into his freezin hands and buries them into his wet pockets.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: This motherfucker better be on time. We’re gonna drown out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain pummels the car. INT. RITCHIE’S CAR Water streams down the windows as they wait. Ritchie shak to keep warm, his hands still in his pockets. Sammy stare into the dark storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vultures are circling, Ritchie. Ritchie looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Some asshole cop is trying to push me into a corner. He turns to Ritchie.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Heard he’s tossing deals to my people, waiting for a bite. Ritchie doesn’t break eye contact. THUNDER breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Did he talk to you?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: No? Sammy’s hand comes up from his side holding a gun.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Should I ask again?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: You’‘1ll get the same answer. Sammy studies Ritchie’s face.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: If I find out you so much as waved to that prick, Ritchie... I’m gonna turn your pretty, little blonde girlfriend into a redhead, I swear to God. Ritchie’s eyes turn cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you? I’m gonna hang you by a power line like an old pair of sneakers. I’ve done worse for less. Ritchie is a statue.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: You think I’m scared of you? (long, uncomfortable beat) Look me in the eye, Ritchie... Look me in the eye and tell me you’re not -- BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG! Smoke and broken glass everywhere Sammy crashes back into his seat. The rain comes through the broken window and washes over him. His eyes still locked on Ritchie. The nose of Ritchie’s .45 sticks out of a smoking hole in his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie drags Sammy’s body out into the rain. He hurries back to his car and drives away... LIGHTNING... Sammy’s dead eyes stare up at the darkness... THUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie wakes up in a hard chair and a cold sweat. He straightens himself out. The JANITOR is mopping the floor near the coffee machine. A NURSE approaches. Ritchie gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Still fighting?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yes, still fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Would you like to see him? He takes a long look down the hall... EXT. DOWNTOWN STREET/RITCHIE’S CAR - NIGHT Ritchie’s arm hangs out the window. A cigarette smolders between his fingers. He throws a glance at the empty passenger seat. THE WINDO Is INTACT. He looks out at the convenience store across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie winces at the bright fluorescents as he enters. The CLERK watches him as he makes his way to the fridges. He pulls the door open and grabs a large can of beer. He drops the giant can on the counter and reaches into hi pockets.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Smokes... cheap ones. Ritchie spots a cute teddy bear on display nearby. He gra it.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: This, too. The clerk slides the pack of smokes across the counter an punches up the total. Ritchie pulls out a few crumpled bills.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Thirteen fifty. Ritchie counts the wrinkled paper in his hands. He reach into his pockets for some more... nothing. He looks up at the clerk’s expressionless face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie walks out with only the smokes in his hands. He tosses the wrapper away and tucks the pack into his jacke He looks up at the building right next to the store. He heads for the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faded wallpaper lines the hall. Ritchie approaches the do at the end of it. He brings his ear to the flaking wood. He hears GIGGLING coming from inside. He knocks. INT. TOMMY’S APARTMENT The place is a mess. TOMMY, a strung-out junky, leaves his equally strung-out GIRLFRIEND on the couch and heads for the door. He trips a few obstacles on his way there. She takes a hit off her pipe. He looks through the peephole.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Open the door, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND
dialogues.text: (exhaling) Who is it, baby? Tommy motions to her to keep quiet.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Open up or it’s coming down.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND
dialogues.text: (whispering) Who the fuck is it? Tommy puts his finger to his lips to shut her up.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: (to the door) Okay! Okay! Hold on! He points to the coffee table. It’s covered in dirty dishes, beer bottles, napkins... She tries to figure out what he’s pointing at and then realizes it’s the knife resting on the half-eaten pizza. She rushes the knife over to him and disappears into the bedroom. Tommy holds the knife behind his sweaty back. He turns th deadbolt. Ritchie walks in and takes in the scene...

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Where’s the girl?

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m calling the fucking cops! Ritchie throws Tommy a heavy look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out here, baby! She emerges from the bedroom, tweaking and shaking.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Do you know why I’m here? They decide to try their luck.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: No. Ritchie takes a deep breath and looks them both over... HE RAMS HIS HEAD INTO TOMMY’S NOSE and sends him crashing to the floor like a sack of shit. The knife flies across the room. The girl rushes to it. S picks it up and points it at Ritchie. Tommy thrashes around on the floor, clutching his bleedin face.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (to Tommy) Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND
dialogues.text: Leave us alone! Ritchie makes his way to the girl. The tip of the blade scrapes the lapels of his leather jacket. He studies her ragged features... Tears run down her cheeks. IN A FLASH, his hand sweeps in and grabs her wrist. She puts up a pretty good fight before letting the knife drop. He kicks it away. She’s really shaking now.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Sit down. She drops into the couch, defeated. He notices some cash on the table. He grabs it.  He makes his way back to Tommy. Blood pours from Tommy’s nose. He tries to wipe it from h mouth and eyes, but it’s everywhere. Ritchie looks through Tommy’s pockets, but comes up short He gives the girl a look before turning Tommy over onto h belly. Ritchie drops his knee onto the back of Tommy’s neck and pins him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I’m not asking again, Tommy. With one hand on Tommy’s wrist, the other grabs hold of h elbow. Ritchie puts on the pressure...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: The bowl! It’s in the fucking bowl! Ritchie looks up at the girl. She jumps to her feet and scurries to the bathroom. Ritchie watches her as she lifts the lid off the tank and pulls out a baggy with little vials in it. She hurries back and tosses it at him.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Is that all of it? Tommy is face down in a puddle of blood and spit.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah! That’s all of it! Now get off me! Ritchie looks up at the girl. She stands in anticipation. He looks back down at the mess on the floor and without further hesitation... HE PULLS TOMMY’S ELBOW BACK WITH A VIOLENT JERK and dislocates the guy’s shoulder. Tommy screams and flops around on the floor. His arm dangles from its socket. His girlfriend rushes to him in horror as he thrashes hysterically. Ritchie picks up the baggy and walks out.  10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie enters. The clerk greets him with no expression. Ritchie grabs the teddy bear from the display, slaps the money he swiped on the counter, and splits. EXT. RITCHIE’S APARTMENT BUILDING/SIDEWALK - NIGHT The street is packed with crumbling buildings and parked cars. POLICE SIRENS fade in the distance. Ritchie stands in the cool night. He takes smoke from his cigarette deep into his lungs. Approaching headlights blast his features. A car stops in front of him. He flicks his cigarette into the darkness. The window rolls down to reveal NIKKI JERGENS, late 20’s, a little rough around the edges but hot as hell. Her smile shines through her long, dark bangs. INT. NIKKI’S CAR Ritchie drops into the passenger seat. Nikki reaches up and turns on the light. He reaches up an turns it off. He fingers his inside pocket and produces the baggy with the vials. He hands it off to her and she slaps a small stack of bills into his waiting hand. Nikki unscrews one of the vials and spills a little bit o its contents onto her wrist. She snorts it back fast and hard while Ritchie counts his money.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Shit! She shuts her eyes tight and rubs her nose.  11.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Take it easy. He gets back out into the cool night.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What are you doing for lunch tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Meet me at the diner. My treat.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: What’s the occasion?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Job offer. Freelance. Great opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: For you or for me?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (big smile) For us. He gives her a nod and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! He turns.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: It was good seeing you again. He continues on his way. She watches him for a beat befor taking another hit of the white powder. INT. RITCHIE’S APARTMENT BUILDING/HALLWAY - NIGHT Ritchie notices someone standing by his door. MIKE MOONY, early 60’s, decked out in a stained wife-beat and shorts, greets Ritchie with a fake smile.  12.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You’re a hard guy to catch. Your schedule’s all over the place. Ritchie unlocks the door. Mike loses the smile and gets in closer.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Three months you owe me, Ritchie... I need at least one or you’re out on your ass. Ritchie stares him down. Mike backs away. He reaches into his pocket and pulls out his new wad. He takes the top twenty from the bundle and slaps the rest into Mike’s sweaty palm. Mike smiles at the size of it. Giant yellow teeth take up most of his face.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Was that so hard? Ritchie leaves him in the hall. INT. RITCHIE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Ritchie tosses his keys onto the short kitchen counter by the door. A lamp lights up the place. The teddy bear sits up agains a pillow on the folded out couch. A few frames on a nearby table show PICTURES OF HIM AND THAT BEAUTIFUL BLONDE FROZEN IN GOOD TIMES. He throws his jacket across the room. It lands on an already full chair, next to a WOODEN CRIB. He drops onto the bed, picks up the bear and gives it a little squeeze.  13. INT. RITCHIE’S CAR - DAY - TRAVELING Ritchie drives in silence. Large, expensive houses pass h by. EXT. BOBBY GOLDEN’S HOUSE - DAY Ritchie pulls up to the sprawling estate. He’s already smoking as he gets out of his car. CHUCK, a mountain of black muscle, greets him at the fron door.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Man, put that out. Ritchie takes one last drag and flicks it away.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Nigga, did I tell you to toss that shit onto my boy’s lawn? Ritchie thinks about it. He reluctantly makes his way across the lawn. He reaches down, picks up the butt, and holds it up to satisfy Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You better wrap that shit ina Kleenex and put it in your pocket. Ritchie enters the house.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I better not find it floating in one of the toilets again, either! EXT. BOBBY GOLDEN’S HOUSE/POOLSIDE Ritchie steps through the patio doors and into a backyard oasis. He shoves the cigarette butt into a nearby plant.  14. A MAN is doing laps in the pool. TALIA, early 20’s, brown and glistening, barely covered i a white bikini, is laying flat on her belly, taking in th sun. Her mirrored sunglasses catch his reflection as he approaches. He waves his hand in front of her face to no reaction. He gives her the finger.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: (smiles) That’s not nice.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: What lap is he on?

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: I stopped counting. Ritchie takes a seat on the deck chair beside her.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: Can you put some lotion on my back?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I don’t want to get my hands dirty.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: That’s too bad. BOBBY GOLDEN pulls himself out of the pool. He’s pushing 50, but not going quietly. His fat gold chain glows again his dark skin. He pulls on a robe. He joins them with a huge smile.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Ritchie! Ritchie stands up and goes in for the wet hug.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You want something to drink?  Bobby leans in. He gives her a 15.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: How about a coffee?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Coffee? It’s like a hundred degrees out here. How about something with ice? Something from a bottle?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don’t think she knows how to make coffee, man.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: I could make coffee.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Then go make some coffee! slap on the ass that gets her to her feet. She struts away. They watch her doors.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And put something on for chrissake! We’ve got company! shake and bake all the way through the patio

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: So how’s it going? How’s your boy? He still hanging in there?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Well, I suggest you do the same. At least you’re keeping busy. Heard you helped Nikki settle a little problem.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. She called in a favor.  16.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Favor, huh? She’s a freaky fruit, that one. I can show you a picture of her from three years ago that’1l empty your balls in three seconds flat. Bobby reaches for a DVD case that’s been sitting on the patio table next to him.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: My dad used to tell me: “Your cock and your signature... watch where you put ‘em’. He tosses it to Ritchie.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: That should take your mind off things. Ritchie examines the box. A buxom beauty graces the cover giant tits pushing out of a prison jumpsuit - “The Hard Cell” in fat pink letters across the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You like porno? Ritchie tosses the box back onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You need to go see a guy for me. I dropped some dough into one of his productions and all I’ve seen so far is that box. He’s not returning my calls. I need you to give him a message for me.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: You want me to... talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, talk. Bring me my money. The address is on the box. Bobby gets up and throws off the robe.  17.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You gonna wait for that coffee? I’m telling you, it’s gonna be a while.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Nah, I’m gonna get going.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’1l see you later. Bobby gets back in the water. Talia meets up with Ritchie.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: Good news: the water’s boiling!

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Rain check?

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: Seriously? You don’t know what you're missing. He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: Hey! Can I ask you something? Between you and me? Do you like it? You know... hurting people? Ritchie gets in close and serious.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Some people need to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place tries hard to look like an old-fashioned diner, but in the bright daylight, it just looks old. A few customers are enjoying their lunches as Ritchie walks in. He eyes the booths and spots Nikki. He joins her.  18.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Hey, you made it.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I never pass up a free lunch.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: That’s good because that’s exactly what I need to talk to you about. The WAITRESS shows up.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Please. She smiles and pours.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Always with the coffee. He takes a long sip.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: A friend of mine is gonna join us. She’s got a situation that you need to hear about. I’1l be back. She slides out of the booth.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (wink) Gotta go powder my nose. He sits back and takes in the view outside. A car SCREECHES across the lot and brakes hard into a spo GWEN DUROVA, late 20’s, platinum blonde and leggy, jumps out of the driver’s side and rushes into the diner. Ritchie watches her. Her movements are quick and erratic. She stomps to the booth and jumps in.  19. He takes another long sip.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Where’s Nikki?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Little girls’ room.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: She fill you in?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Great. The WAITRESS shows up smiling again.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Fuck off. Her smile fades. She scrams. Gwen looks like she’s been up for a couple of days. Ritch sips his coffee and watches her. Gwen’s eyes widen as Nikki returns and slides in next to her.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (big smile) Hey! Nikki grabs her hands.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You alright? Gwen throws her a shaky nod.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Ritchie, this is Gwen. This is our free lunch. Ritchie continues to sip his coffee.  20.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (to Gwen) Go ahead. Gwen gathers herself before starting.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: My husband keeps a gym bag full of money in our closet. I’ve never counted it, but there must be about fifty grand in there, easy. You and Nikki are welcome to all of it.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: My husband is a cocksucker. He’s a very successful, very wealthy... cocksucker. And I don’t want him breathing anymore. Ritchie throws Nikki a cool stare.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Right. Well, good luck with that. He jumps out of the booth and heads for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (to Gwen) I‘1l handle this. Don’t worry. She catches up with him.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Hey! What’re you doing? Ice cold stare right at her.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Outside. He throws the door open and storms out. Nikki looks over at Gwen before following.  21. EXT. PARKING LOT/RITCHIE’S CAR Ritchie drops into the driver’s seat. Nikki gets in next him. INT. RITCHIE’S CAR He watches Gwen through the window. She tries to stay cal but looks more and more out of place.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I can’t help her.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: We’re talking some serious money here.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: We’re talking murdering some poor bastard in cold blood.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: If it’s any consolation, the guy’s an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: It’s not.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: This is a fucking retirement fund, man. We’re gonna be set for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: We get caught: we get put away for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I don’t understand what the problem is. Whatever it is that you do and whatever it is that I need you to do, are like the same fucking thing.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: You’re right, you don’t understand.  22. Nikki notices Gwen shift around in her seat, eyeballing them hard through the window.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Listen, she’s gonna bail. 1/11 fucking do it without you. I don’t need to share.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: You’re not gonna do anything.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Yeah, I will. You don’t know how bad things are. Her face finally loses its smile. Ritchie takes a good lo look at her. He turns back to the nervous wreck inside.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: An old friend.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: How old?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: She’s cool, okay?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Who’s the husband?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Some accountant or something. Does it make a difference?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, it makes a difference. Fifty grand - that’s a lot of money - someone’s gonna miss that. Successful accountant - someone’s gonna miss him, too. Something like this needs planning, research, time --

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: No time. She wants it done today.  23.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Today? You’re out of your mind. Anything happens to this guy today, how hard is it gonna be for someone to remember all of us chit-chatting over here?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Are you gonna help me or not? He waits for her smile to come back. It doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Tell her I can make it look like a robbery; put the prick in the hospital for a while. But I’m not killing anybody, and definitely not today.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Okay. She throws open the door and jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Walk away from this, Nikki. It’s not your thing. Go in there. Calm her down. We'll find another way. Her smile slowly creeps back.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I’‘1l1 see what she says. He watches her. She makes her way inside and back to the booth. Gwen listens to every word. Nikki’s lips stop moving. Gwen mouths something to her. Nikki turns to the window a slowly shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Shit. He starts the car up fast and peels out even faster.  24. INT. “PINK MONKEY STUDIOS”/TRENT’S OFFICE - DAY HEATHER, a beautiful face in a baggy sweat suit, sits ata desk across from TRENT ROTHSTEIN, mid 40’s, balding, greasy, wearing an expensive suit and a cheap mustache. The office is small and dank. The far wall is covered in photographs of naked young girls in various poses on a couch. Beneath the collage: the couch. She chews gum as he looks through some papers and makes a few notes.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Rosie Cheeks? He looks up at her. She blows a bubble.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (back to the notes) What’s your real name, honey?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Heather.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: How old are you, Heather?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Eighteen He looks up and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: That’s a good answer. She returns the smile.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: It says here that you’ve done some modeling. What are we talking, Internet?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.  25.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (back to his notes) Have you done anything like this before?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You mean, “Make movies”? Trent stops writing. He looks up at her again, this time without the smile.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Films... yes.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Not really. He looks her over carefully...

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: You okay with rough stuff? Gang Bangs? Weird shit?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Girl on girl?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: of course.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Of course. Can you squirt? You a squirter?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Not that I know of.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Not a big deal. Listen, Heather, before we go any further, I need to know what your boyfriend thinks of this career path you've decided to take.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I don’t have a boyfriend.  26. The smile is back.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: That’s another good answer. He makes a final note in his papers and sits back with th smile still on his face. He looks the young lady over som more.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Any questions before we get started? She shifts in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Um... well... I have Herpes.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (still smiling) Okay?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I was told that you don’t care about that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t say that I don’t care. I do, however, manage to work around “that stuff”. Hey, we all gotta eat, right? She looks more at ease. He reaches into his desk and pulls out a small digital camera.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Heather, I’d like to take some pictures now, if that’s alright with you. See what kind of treasures you got hiding underneath all of that awful clothing.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Sure. He gets to his feet. He motions to her to do the same.  27. She unzips her sweatshirt. Her skin-tight t-shirt struggl to hold down her giant breasts. Trent fumbles with his camera.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Everything?

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Please. She sits on the couch and unlaces her sneakers. A loud BUZZ fills the room.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: (over speaker, filtered) Mr. Rothstein? There’s a gentleman here to see you? Trent manages to turn the camera on. Heather continues to undress.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: BETTY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over speaker, filtered) He says he’s an associate of Bobby Golden’s.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Tell him to fuck off. I’m busy.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over speaker, filtered) Um... Trent looks up, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: You have me on speaker again, don’t you? Silence. Trent rushes over and grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (into phone) Pick up the phone.  28. INT. “PINK MONKEY STUDIOS” /LOBBY BETTY, late 40’s, short and round, looks over at Ritchie through her black-rimmed glasses.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over speaker, filtered) Pick up the phone, Betty! She picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Is he a big guy? Betty looks Ritchie over.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: Big enough, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Big enough for what?

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Stall him.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: He’s already on his way.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Great! He slams the phone down and rushes over to Heather. He quickly picks up all of her clothes.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Heather, we’re gonna have to reschedule, but so far, I love what I’m seeing. He pushes her clothes into her chest and leads her to the door.  29.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Betty will give you everything you need on your way out - paperwork, release forms, standard shit. We’ll call you. He pushes her into the hallway just as Ritchie shows up. escorts him in with a forced smile.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Hey, give me one second. Have a seat. Trent sits at his desk and straightens himself out a bit. He puts his notes into one neat pile. Ritchie takes a seat in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Great girl. Big... big future. So... what can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Bobby wants his money.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Really? Well, you can tell Bobby the film’s in post. He’s gonna have to wait like everybody else.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I’m not his secretary.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: I don’t know what else to tell you. Ritchie eyes him for a moment. He takes in the scene. He notices the wall across the roo with the dirty collage and the dirtier couch. He turns his attention back to Trent.  30.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I’m leaving here with a fistful of your money or a fistful of your teeth. I’1ll give you a minute to decide which one you’d like to part with today. Trent’s face goes cold. He casually reaches into his drawer. He pulls out a gun. He lays it on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: You know what that is? It’s goodbye. The two men are in a standoff. Ritchie glances between the piece on the desk and Trent’s smug face... A VIOLENT KICK TO THE DESK sends the whole fucking thing flying into Trent’s ribs. He’s thrown backwards onto the floor. Ritchie leaps over the desk and lands hard on top of him. Trent gasps for air under the weight. His collar disappears into Ritchie’s clenching fists as he’s lifted off the floor. Trent tries to bat Ritchie’s hands away, but they don’t budge. His shirt starts to cho him out.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let him go. Ritchie loosens his grip. Trent drops to the floor. PETE SOMMERSED, early 50’s, a gorilla dressed like a man, hogs the doorway. Ritchie gets to his feet. Trent crawls away.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I thought I smelled dogshit. Trent makes it to the couch. Pete crosses the scene.  31.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: I think the fucker broke a rib! Pete picks up Trent’s gun from the floor and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: It’s a prop.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I know. He pulls back his jacket and reveals a holstered .38; a detective badge hangs off his belt.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: This one isn’t. He lifts the chair and straightens it out.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I need you to sit down, Ritchie.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: You know this guy? Pete takes a seat behind the desk.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Sit down. Ritchie sits. Pete plays with the prop gun.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: It’s been a long time.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Seems like yesterday to me.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You still holding that grudge, huh? I did you a favor, man. If I hadn't stepped in, you’d be up to your larynx in prison cock right now.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: What do you want, Pete?  32.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Actually, believe it or not, I might have some more work for you.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: What’re you doing? Pete raises his finger and shuts Trent up - eyes still on Ritchie.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I paid my debt. Pete finds that funny.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Debt? You’re never done owing the devil, Ritchie. A BUZZING comes from Ritchie’s jacket. He pulls his phone out just enough: “Nikki cell” flashes on the screen. He quickly presses a button and silences it.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I didn’t come here for a job. Call an ambulance. Your friend doesn’t look too good.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You come work for me again and you'll be hitting the big time... or at least the bigger time. BUZZING again. Nikki again. He ignores it again.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I never worked for you. Get it straight.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Call it what you want. BUZZING again. Ritchie shuts it off.  33.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I’m here for Bobby’s money. If you don’t have it, I’11l be back tomorrow. If you don’t have it then, I’1l be back the next day, and the next. And I can’t guarantee how many bodily functions your friend over there will still have control of until I get it.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Bobby, huh? Pete takes a second before turning around to Trent.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Give him the money. Trent massages his chest. His shirt is still wrinkled fro the tussle.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: It’s in whatever's left of my desk. Pete struggles with the drawer. He opens it and pulls out fat envelope. He tosses it to Ritchie.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: See? We can all be friends. Ritchie grabs the envelope. He opens it and runs his thum across the bills inside.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: There’s a hell of a lot more where that came from. You’re wasting your time running fetch missions for Bobby. Think about it. My door is always open. Ritchie puts the envelope away He takes one last look around and is out the door. Pete’s face turns to stone.  34. EXT. “PINK MONKEY STUDIOS” /STREET - DAY Ritchie quickly pulls out his phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over phone, filtered) Hi! It’s Nikki! Leave a message! He hangs up and gets into his car. EXT. BOBBY GOLDEN’S HOUSE - DAY Ritchie’s car comes to a quick stop. He jumps out and hea for the front door. He flicks his cigarette across the lawn. Rings the doorbell. Talia opens the door. Her face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: Hey! Back for that coffee? Ritchie storms past her. INT. BOBBY GOLDEN’S HOUSE/LIVING ROOM Bobby watches TV. Chuck sits nearby. Ritchie walks in. Talia follows. Chuck gets up. Bobby waves him down.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: How did it go?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: How do you think it went?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Pete Sommersed showed up.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Shit.  35. Bobby turns the TV off.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I need the work, Bobby, but I don’t need the bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: He’s never there. If he was, something’s up... What did you talk about?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: He tried to recruit me.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Work.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Work? Come here. Bobby takes him aside.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Look, I fucked up. I wasn’t thinking, okay? I’m sorry. Forget about that piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Why would you send me there?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey, money’s money, right? I don’t send you on jobs for fun. I already apologized now get over it. Sammy’s days were numbered. There was a fucking line forming behind you. At least you got something out of it.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t have sent me there, Bobby. Bobby tenses up.  36.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me what I should or shouldn’t do. Take a step back and realize where your place is, Ritchie. You’re lucky I’m not making you pick up my dry cleaning at this point. We go way back, but that doesn’t mean we have to go any further. Ritchie looks around. He pulls out the fat envelope from his jacket and drops it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I know my place, Bobby. You don’t need to remind me. But if you put me in a situation like that again, I’m coming back here and redecorating. Chuck stands up.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: We’re done, Ritchie. No more handouts. Walk away or crawl, it’s up to you. Ritchie stares them all down. He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (to Chuck) He doesn’t get through that door again. INT. RITCHIE’S BUILDING/HALLWAY - NIGHT TWO BIG GUYS are on their way down the hall as Ritchie rounds the corner. FRANKY wears a shiny green tracksuit and ROCCO sports a thinly shaved beard that follows his jaw- line like a night crawler. Mike stands in his doorway slobbering over an apple, eyes on Ritchie. The two men disappear into his apartment. Ritchie ignores them.  37. INT. RITCHIE’S APARTMENT The place is dark. Ritchie tosses his keys on the counter and heads for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: He turns on the light. The mirror is fogged up. He runs a finger across it. He hurries out.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: The light from the bathroom reveals Nikki sitting on the floor near the window. Her hair is wet. Her hands are shaking. He approaches with caution.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here, Nikki?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Regrouping. He gets closer. Her eyes are somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I fucked up. He lifts her chin up.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: You need to tell me what happened.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I need a priest.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I did like you said. I tried to calm her down - get her mind off things.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: How?  38. INT. GWEN’S HOUSE/LIVING ROOM - DAY (FLASHBACK) Gwen lets out a DEEP MOAN. Nikki sits beside her on the couch. Her arm is stretched across her lap, her hand buried between Gwen’s legs. Gwen’s panties are stretched across her thighs. Her skirt conceals what’s happening underneath. Gwen leans back, exhausted. Nikki wipes her hand on the couch and takes care of a lin of cocaine waiting for her on the glass coffee table. The living room is gigantic: Paintings, sculptures... ver classy. Nikki looks over at Gwen and sees that she’s sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Hey! Come on. She moves in to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I can’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: It’s a party, right? No tears, remember?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I’m suffocating. This house, these walls, this fucking furniture! She kicks the table.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Hey! Nikki rushes to make sure the drugs are okay.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I can’t go on like this. I can’t.  39.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You can do a lot worse. I mean, he’s not even around. Who cares what he’s doing? Look at this place! She goes down for another line.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You don’t understand Nikki tosses her head back and rubs her nose.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: He’s a terrible person.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Who isn’t?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: He... the things he’s done. She looks off into the distance. INT. RITCHIE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT (PRESENT DAY)

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: She told me he knocked her around a lot. One time... hard. She lost a baby and her uterus. INT. GWEN’S HOUSE/BEDROOM - DAY (FLASHBACK) A large duffel bag drops at Nikki’s bare feet. Gwen rummages through her closet. She sets off an avalanc of shoeboxes. She grabs the one she wants. She approaches Nikki. Their noses are red, their eyes, watery and alive. Gwen hands her the box. Nikki holds it as Gwen lifts the lid. She reaches in and pulls out a revolver.  40.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Look. It’s all here. See? Nikki’s eyes try to focus.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Take it. She knocks the box away and places the gun in Nikki’s sti outstretched hands. She forces Nikki’s fingers around the cold metal. Gwen gets in real close.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I‘1l call him. Right now, I’11 call him and I’11 tell him to come home. I’1l say we’ve been robbed. I’11 get him here. Please do it. Please. Nikki struggles with the situation. She says nothing. She sees the desperation in Gwen’s eyes. Her hands are closed firmly on top of hers. Her toes touch the duffel bag as Gwen pulls in closer.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Listen, Gwen. I -- BANG! The gun goes off and sends Gwen's brains flying across the room. Her body drops to the floor in a second. Nikki is left standing in total, freaked-out silence. Her face is covered in blood; her hands still gripping th revolver; her eyes wide open. INT. GWEN’S HOUSE/LIVING ROOM - DAY Nikki dials her phone. Brains and blood are caked on her face and in her hair. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Shit! Nikki wipes the table clean and gathers her things. She picks up her shoes and gets the fuck out of there.  41. EXT. GWEN’S HOUSE - DAY Nikki walks out barefoot into the quiet street. She takes quick, nervous steps to her car. She gets in and peels ou INT. RITCHIE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT (PRESENT DAY) Ritchie is speechless. Nikki sits, rubbing her hands.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Did anybody see you?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. But the gun made a lot of noise. Ritchie paces. He peeks out at the street from the cracks in the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: There’s something else. Nikki reaches into the darkness beside her and pulls out the duffel bag. She slides it over to Ritchie. He freezes. He crouches down and unzips it. He pulls it open to reveal a shit load of cash.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There’s a lot more than fifty grand in there.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (staring at the money) Are you sure no one saw you?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Ninety nine percent. Ritchie looks up to meet her eyes... BUZZING interrupts their moment. It’s coming from Ritchie pocket. He reaches in and pulls out his phone. His eyes widen as he looks at the caller ID: “Nikki cell” flashes the screen.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Where’s your phone?  42. Nikki rushes to her feet. She throws open her jacket. Nothing. She empties out her purse. No phone. She joins Ritchie and looks down at the flashing screen.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck! Ritchie’s face tenses. The BUZZING doesn’t stop.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Don’t answer it. Ritchie answers it. He swallows hard as he holds the phon to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over phone, filtered) Hello, Ritchie. INT. GWEN’S HOUSE/BEDROOM - NIGHT Pete stands over Gwen’s body. He’s wearing rubber gloves, holding Nikki’s phone inches from his face.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I bet my voice sounds like Christmas morning to you now, huh? INT. RITCHIE’S APARTMENT Ritchie doesn’t blink.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (whispering) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over phone, filtered) You think we can talk about that job offer now?  43. INT. GWEN’S HOUSE/LIVING ROOM - NIGHT DIMITRI DUROV, late 60’s, nice suit, bad hair, sits on th couch. His leg shakes nervously. ALEXEI, his giant goon, stands by the front entrance. Pete comes down the stairs. Dimitri rushes to him.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: (thick Russian accent) You saw?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You did good by calling me first. Pete looks around. He notices smudges on the coffee table but gets back to his man.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You said you found her like that?

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: I did not know she was so unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna clean this up for you, Dimitri. You know what that means, right?

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: Anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You know what I want.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: I cannot touch him. I can do anything else but that. Pete looks at Alexei by the door. Back to Dimitri.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: What if it wasn’t suicide?  44.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You don’t squeak. You got enemies. Maybe it’s a message.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: Only a coward would behave this way.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: How much would a name mean to you? Dimitri drops into the couch, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: Who would do such a thing?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: If there is a “who”, I’1l find him.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: Deliver the coward and I will speak to bosses.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Wait a half hour after I leave. Then, call the cops. They won’t find anything. Try to act broken up. It’1ll help.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: Is there any way we can keep them out of this?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: She’s your wife. You can’t just bring her up to the cabin. The neighbors are gonna notice she’s not driving around anymore. Play dumb. Trust me. It‘’1ll blow over.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: I cannot go to jail.  45.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: It’s prison, actually... but nobody’s going anywhere. They’11 stop at suicide. They won’t dig any deeper. Silence. Pete looks them both over.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Half hour. He squeezes passed Alexei on his way out. INT. RITCHIE’S APARTMENT/KITCHEN - NIGHT Coffee brews on the counter. A burning cigarette dangles between Ritchie’s fingers as he stands by. He watches Nikki make neat little stacks of hundreds on t living room floor. One last bill is placed on one last pile.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Two-fifty... even.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (to himself) Two-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What do you wanna do? Smoke spews from his lips.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You think the cop knows about it?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know what he knows. I know what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What does he want?  46.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Blood. The machine BEEPS; the coffee’s ready. He turns to the waiting mugs.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: How do you take it?

dialogues.speaker: CLICK
dialogues.text: He turns. Nikki has a gun in her hand. She makes her way to him. He keeps his eyes on the gun. She sets it down on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I was gonna do it, Ritchie. I was gonna blow him away for her... for that pile of paper over there. Her gaze drifts towards the little money village on the living room floor. He reaches out slowly and takes the gun. He flicks the safety on and slides it away from her.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Why can’t we just run?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Do you know who this guy is?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Some dirty cop?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: That’s a fucking understatement. She gets back to the stacks. He sips and watches her as s gets on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Do you remember the guy I used to run with? Sammy “Two Balls”?  47.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Do you know what happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: He was shot. Drug deal gone sideways, right?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: This “dirty cop”... He busted Sammy one day with half a key in his pants, but instead of booking him, he tried to make a deal... Sammy didn’t make deals with cops. Nikki runs her hands through the stacks.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: So he shot him?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: No. He wanted to make an example out of him... He had a dozen dealers just like Sammy in his pocket. Not to mention cookers, junkies, gangbangers, psychos and half of the downtown police department. He had a reputation to protect. The cash covers the floor now.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: He makes a call one day and sends Sammy a message that not only makes it to his ear, but right through his fucking skull.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Where were you? Ritchie struggles with the answer.  48.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I delivered it.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (looks up) No shit?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: He caught me with blood on my hands about a month earlier. Figured we can “help each other out”.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: How much blood?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Enough to put me away for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: So, let’s make a deal, then. Either that or we kill him.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I thought of that. Dirty or not, though, he’s still a cop. That’s a hard kill.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What do you wanna do, then? Ritchie looks at the thick carpet of money at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Got any blow left? INT. RITCHIE’S APARTMENT BUILDING/MIKE’S DOOR - NIGHT MRS. DELUCA, decked out in curlers and a bathrobe, shows and knocks. There’s some COMMOTION coming from inside. The door opens and Mike greets her with a big yellow smil She looks inside and sees Franky and Rocco sitting at a table in the middle of the room. It’s covered in beer bottles and stacks of poker chips.  49.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Mrs. DeLuca, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DELUCA
dialogues.text: How am I? That jerk in 3C is smoking again. My kids are trying to do their homework, but instead they’re getting lung cancer! Mike throws a glance down the hall. INT. RITCHIE’S DOOR Mike knocks. Mrs. DeLuca watches from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Open up, Ritchie! He turns to Mrs. DeLuca and gives her a nod.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Ritchie! If you don’t open this goddamn door, I’m gonna call the cops and they can -- The door opens a crack. Ritchie’s eyes are wild - cigaret dangling from his lips.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Fuck off? This is a non-smoking building, you understand? People are trying to live here... Put it out or get out. Ritchie shuts the door. Mike looks over at Mrs. DeLuca. S shakes her head. He gathers himself and bangs on the door again.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Ritchie! If you don’t put that shit out, I’m gonna come in there and put it out for you, I swear to Christ!  50. The door opens fast and wide. Mike jumps back. Ritchie steps out and holds up a thin stack of cash.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Fuck. Off. Mike cautiously approaches and takes it from him. He takes a quick peek inside and sees Nikki sitting in th pile of money, doing a line of coke off her wrist. Ritchie gets back inside and shuts the door. Mike stands for a beat, thinking. He heads back to his apartment. He counts the bills as he walks by Mrs. DeLuca.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DELUCA
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Go home, Mrs. DeLuca. He shuts the door behind him. INT. RITCHIE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Ritchie grabs the gun from the counter and makes his way the couch. He picks up the duffel bag.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Come on. We gotta go. He tosses the gun into the bag and begins filling it with handfuls of money from the floor. She watches him.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: How many people have you killed?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: what?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: He found you with blood on your hands. Counting Sammy, that’s at least two, right?  51.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t say they were people. Ten years ago, you catch me with a smoking gun, I surrender, no problem. What did I know? But... after five years inside... your perspective changes a bit. You tend not to wanna go for the repeat. After that, the choice between smoking some lowlife and doing hard time again isn’t a choice at all.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I’ve never killed anyone before.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: It was an accident. Don’t torture yourself.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do? He avoids the question. Continues to fill the bag.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Do you believe in God, Ritchie?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (filling the bag) What's the difference?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: It changes things.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: NIIKI
dialogues.text: Yeah. We’re either a bunch of meat and bones, or there’s a soul swimming around in here somewhere. His eyes go to the teddy bear on the kitchen counter.  52.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: If he’s just make-believe, we have nothing to worry about, but if he’s out there... we’re in deep shit. He’s done filling the bag.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t worry too much about God.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Look around... he ain’t here. There’s a KNOCK at the door. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s him.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Get your stuff. Ritchie goes to answer it... THE DOOR IS KICKED IN, smashing him over the face. He’s sent flying across the room. Nikki jumps to her feet. Franky and Rocco enter the apartment followed by Mike. He Manages to get the rattled door closed behind him. She grabs the duffel bag.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What do you retards want? Mike paces behind his two large friends. Ritchie tries to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: My sister has a boy with Down Syndrome. Great kid. That term cuts like a knife every time I hear it.  53. Mike looks around.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We’re gonna take all that dough I saw you rolling around in earlier, plus whatever’s left of that shit you were putting up your nose. Mike sizes her up.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And while we’re at it, I think we'll have that dirty mouth of yours wrapped around our cocks later, too. Your boyfriend, here, can watch.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: He’s not my boyfriend. Franky licks his lips. Nikki reaches into the bag.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I think I‘1l have Franky knock your teeth out first, though... you look like a biter. Ritchie spits out some blood.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Take your boys and go, Mike. That’s all the warning you’re gonna get.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (laughing) Are you serious? Ritchie stumbles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m not giving you a warning, Ritchie. I’m making you a promise - a promise that these men will do terrible things to you and your girl tonight if you don’t step aside.  54. Ritchie’s shoulders and neck let out a couple of awful cracks as he straightens out. He looks over at Nikki. She has her hand deeper in the ba Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (to Mike) This isn’t a fair fight. Nikki’s hand is elbow deep in the duffel bag.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: You should go get a couple more guys. Everyone is frozen... Mike laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Fuck him up, boys. Franky winds up a powerful right that slices through the air. Ritchie ducks out of the way and lands a knee hard into his ribs. His elbow follows fast and shatters Franky jaw. Franky’s body slumps to the carpet, revealing Rocco comin right for them. He lunges at Ritchie and is stopped in his tracks by a bi boot to the balls. A ferocious right to Rocco’s face send blood and spit flying onto Mike’s wife-beater. He’s knocked out instantly and crashes to the floor at Mike’s feet. A yellow smile appears on Mike’s sweaty face.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Bygones? INT. RITCHIE’S APARTMENT BUILDING/HALLWAY - NIGHT Mrs. DeLuca mumbles to herself as she storms towards Ritchie’s door.  55. MIKE COMES CRASHING THROUGH IT and hits the wall hard. He doesn’t get up. Mrs. DeLuca screams. Nikki and Ritchie step through the shattered doorway and disappear down the hall. INT. RITCHIE’S CAR - NIGHT They jump in. Ritchie puts the key in, but doesn’t turn i

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: We have to make a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie’s car pulls into a spot.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (smiles) Sure. I’1l watch the bag. He doesn’t smile back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie walks with the duffel in his hands. Nikki catches up with him.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You know, technically, that’s my money.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: When this is over, you’1ll get your cut.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: My cut? You steered clear remember? I’m the one who got the fucking brain facial.  56. He looks around trying to find his way. She stops him before he turns down another hallway.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Hey! Seriously, we split the money now. We go our separate ways. Fuck deals. Fuck the cop.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: He’s gonna find you.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Let him. He has my cell phone. So what? The nurse spots Ritchie and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: This guy goes into people’s closets, pulls out all their skeletons and dangles them over their heads every chance he gets. I’ve seen your closet. You don’t want him in there. She quiets down.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Mr. Boland?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Can I see him now? She throws a probing look at Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: I‘1l see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie washes his hands. A sign next to the sink tells h how to do it properly. Above his head is a shelf labeled “CLEAN”. It’s covered i folded hospital gowns. He puts one on over his clothes. He follows the nurse to a lone incubator near the back window.  57. The nurse steps aside with a smile and reveals a tiny bod inside - blindfolded, attached to a mess of wires and tubes, little chest breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: It’s alright. Ritchie pulls the teddy bear out and rests it on the plastic box.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Take your time. He examines the helpless little guy in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki sits with the duffel bag in her lap. The nurse goes to the nearby coffee machine and drops som change in its slot. She pushes some buttons and waits for the machine to do its thing. She glances at Nikki while s waits. Nikki can see into the nursery down the hall. She watches Ritchie with a frown.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Going through something like this alone must be impossible. You must be a good friend.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (cold) I’m not his friend. THE MACHINE FUCKS UP AND COFFEE SPILLS EVERYWHERE. The nurse jumps and tries to control the mess.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Shit! INT. RITCHIE’S CAR - NIGHT - TRAVELING Ritchie is focused on the road. Nikki throws glances at h through the silence.  58. EXT. “PINK MONKEY STUDIOS” /STREET - NIGHT Ritchie’s car comes to a stop. INT. RITCHIE’S CAR He kills the engine.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Well, get ready.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: When were you gonna tell me?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Tell you what?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: About, whatever that was back there?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I wasn’t.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Just like that? What we had - that doesn’t entitle me to some answers?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: That was a million years ago and no, it doesn’t. Let’s go. EXT. RITCHIE’S CAR He jumps out. She stays put. He comes around to her side. She stares out the windshiel without even blinking.  59. He looks around... The street lamps sparkle in the wet pavement. He lights a cigarette, takes a deep drag and drops his he in defeat. He knocks She rolls on her window. it down; her eyes still focused on the street.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: There was a girl... Things got serious, but then quickly turned to shit, so she bailed. Showed up six months later with a sob story and a baby-bump. She finally turns to face him.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: How do you know it’s yours?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: A blast from her past saw her crossing the street one day and decided to run her over with his camry. A car speeds by and interrupts him.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: They managed to save the kid, but he won’t wake up... They tell me I’m wasting my time and money - that I should pull the plug and move on. His heartbeat’s stronger than mine and they’re telling me to shut it down like it’s nothing.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What are you holding on to? That kid doesn’t belong here.  60.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Like you said... we’re more than just meat, right? He flicks his cigarette into the street.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You think buying a teddy bear is gonna absolve you of all your sins, Ritchie? Wake up. You’re not a father. You don’t bring people into this world, you take them out. Let’s take this money and get the hell out of here. He walks away. EXT. “PINK MONKET STUDIOS” /ENTRANCE She jumps out and catches up to him at the door.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What do you think this guy is gonna ask us to do? Paint his house? We take the money and run... right now. Ritchie pushes the door bell.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: We need to end this right. Pete is one loose end you don't want dangling in the wind. The door BUZZES open. Ritchie enters. She hesitates befor following. INT. “PINK MONKEY STUDIOS”/TRENT’S OFFICE Pete sits in Trent’s chair with Nikki’s phone in his hand He looks through its contents. Trent is occupied with Heather on the couch. He whispers bullshit into her ear and she fakes a few giggles. She’s practically bursting out of a skin-tight dress. Ritchie and Nikki walk through the door. Pete stands up.  61.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (to Nikki) We meet at last. The pictures on this phone do not do you justice. He reaches out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Peter Sommersed... Detective Peter Sommersed. Her eyes go to Ritchie. Pete takes back his meaty paw. They sit down. He continues browsing through her phone.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: There are a lot of pictures in here. Some of them, I have to confess, I already jerked-off to, but a few others... I’m just not that into. He flips the cell over so they can see a picture of a bloodied Gwen on the screen. He shuffles blindly to more shots of her from different angles. Nikki’s face goes white.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m no Ansel Adams, but --

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: What do you want, Pete? He puts the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I live in the shade, Ritchie, as you know. I pull the strings on dozens of puppet shows, but that doesn’t mean I’m not a serious businessman. This... studio... is one of the good ones. We make quality movies here.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Films.  62.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Films... The talent, as you can see, is top notch. Ritchie looks over at Heather.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Cash and pussy go in and out of here like fucking clockwork. Most of it lands right into our laps, too, but a lot of it... doesn’t quite make the trip. He leans in closer.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (To Nikki) Can you give us a minute, honey? Maybe ten? Nikki looks around.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Where do you want me to go?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Trent! Why don’t you give this young lady the tour? Trent drops Heather in a flash and gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: of course! He straightens his tie and pats down his hair as he strut to the desk. He gives her his hand.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (to Pete) I don’t want the tour. I wanna know what I need to do to get out of this shit.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (deadpan) You need to take the tour. Nikki looks at Ritchie. He nods.  63.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Whatever. She walks out. Trent follows. Pete turns around to Heather who is still on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You, too, sweetheart. Heather jumps up and jiggles all the way out the door. Pe gets back to business.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: In order for this machine to keep working, we have to deal with certain silent partners; backers that provide various, necessary services that keep the whole thing moving smoothly. These guys... they partnered up with a local financier and made him their official talent scout. The guy’s a fucking scumbag.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: That’s funny.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: He takes all the best girls and leaves us with scraps. So instead of getting a decent stable set up, we’re left scrounging the bottom of the pile every time. Make-up and lighting can only do so much.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Seems like a no-brainer. Your reach should go way past this type of shit.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, it doesn’t. He leans back again, hesitating for once.  64.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: The backers are in the Russian mob. Ritchie’s face goes cold.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: And, like I said, they’re head- over-heels for this jerk-off, so he’s not budging.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Russians?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I don’t want this to go down like a regular hit. I need it to be done different.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Different? How long is it gonna take for the Russians to find out who fucked up their new BFF? Ritchie pulls out his pack of smokes and lights up.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: This morning, I show up and there you are, like a fucking sign, so I asked... You said “no”. Now... you’re here... He holds up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: And here... So, I’m asking again. Same deal as last time.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Asking, huh? Ritchie lets out a cloud from his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: What do you mean by “different”? Pete leans in closer.  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A monster of a house is perched on the edge of a cliff.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He throws a party every Friday night. The driveway wraps around the front. Expensive cars are everywhere. A PAIR OF LONG LEGS pops out of one of them.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He invites new talent to his house every week for some fucked up meet ‘n’ greet. Invite only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The long legs are escorted through the party - about a dozen half-naked men and women, drinking, dancing, snorting, fucking, you name it.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He likes to handpick his stock, so he makes sure to be there every time. A FIGURE sits in the shadows, waiting. He takes a sip of his drink as the legs stop in front of him. The shoes com off and the dress drops to the floor. INT. “PINK MONKEY STUDIOS”/TRENT’S OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Trent’s bringing Heather tonight... plus two.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Tonight? I need at least two weeks for a job like this, and with the Russians sniffing around, two weeks if you’re lucky.  66.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I don’t have two weeks. You don’t have two weeks. There’s nothing to plan here. I’m telling you how I need this to go down. You should be taking fucking notes. Ritchie leans back and sucks back some more smoke.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Russians aren’t gonna have a hard time getting to that guest list.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Everyone there’s gonna be zonked out of their asses. Get him alone. Make it look like an overdose.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Overdose? Give me the address. I‘1l wait until the party’s over, get him alone, pop him in his sleep.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: If there’s even one fucking clue left behind that this was a hit, the Ruskies will scour the earth for our asses. This way, they’11 chalk it up to poor judgment. He reaches into his pocket and pulls out a bottle of pill

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: He’s a pill-popper. He’s gonna think it’s his birthday. Ritchie grabs the bottle and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You gotta look like you’re there to fuck and take names. Wipe that frown off your face and get into character.  67.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: You’re not giving me much time to prepare. Overdose? Tell me to turn this guy into hamburger meat and I won’t bat an eye, but this... I’m not exactly dressed for the part, either.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You can grab something from wardrobe. Ritchie turns around. Trent stands with the girls by his side. Nikki is decked out in a slinky little number and i full makeup.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: There’s one more thing you need to know.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: His name... it’s Bobby Golden.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Bobby? Ritchie looks at Nikki. She throws him a pissed “I told y so” look.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: He’s not your friend, Ritchie. He’s not worth this second thought. What did he tell you about me? Did he come clean? My guess is “no”. We’ve been down this road before. You’re torn up, I get it, it sucks, but there’s no time to discuss this any further. (gets up) You leave in an hour. Pete walks out. Trent and Heather take off right after.  68.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I’m thinking.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Not one of your strong suits. Ritchie dials his phone and paces.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Come on, Bobby. Pick up.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What’s the plan?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: He’s not answering.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: This is it... we take the back door out of here.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: We play along; we go to Bobby's; I‘1l figure something out. His eyes lock onto hers. INT. “PINK MONKEY STUDIOS”/LOBBY - NIGHT Pete leans up against the front desk. Trent horses around with Heather near the door. Ritchie shows up wearing a cheesy, shiny gray suit. Somehow, he makes it work. Nikki follows close behind.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (to Pete) We’re done after this. No more deals. Pete holds up Nikki’s phone with a dead Gwen still up on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You’1l get it back when it’s over.  69. He puts the phone in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: As for future business together, well... that’s up to you, isn’t it? He gives Ritchie a dirty smile.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let’s go! Ritchie heads for the door where everyone is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Hey! They all turn. Pete approaches. He reaches into Ritchie's pants and pulls out his gun.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: My way, remember? Pete slides the gun into his own pants and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (to Ritchie) You drive. He tosses Ritchie the keys. EXT. TRENT’S MERCEDES - NIGHT - TRAVELING The car cruises through the suburbs. INT. TRENT’S MERCEDES - NIGHT - TRAVELING Ritchie is focused on the road. Trent continues his dead-end efforts with Heather in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (to Ritchie) Hey! I heard about you and Sammy.  70. Ritchie eyes him in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: If that’s how you treat your friends, I’d hate to see what you do to your enemies. Ritchie’s eyes are locked onto Trent. Trent drops the smile. EXT. BOBBY GOLDEN’S HOUSE/DRIVEWAY - NIGHT The Benz makes its way around. It passes a couple of park cars.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Looks like we’re early. They stop and get out. Ritchie looks up at the house. EXT. BOBBY GOLDEN’S HOUSE/ENTRANCE The door opens and IOSIF, a boulder of a man with no neck and no personality, blocks the way. Ritchie and Nikki exchange worried glances.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Iosif. You look fetching tonight. Let me guess... new chin? Iosif stares them all down. He motions to Trent to raise his arms. Trent obliges and Iosif proceeds to pat him dow He gives Ritchie the same gesture. Ritchie lifts his arms Iosif finds the small pill bottle. Ritchie doesn’t break eye contact. Iosif pockets them. He looks over at Nikki and Heather. Their dresses cling to their bodies like plastic wrap. He smiles and steps aside.  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosif leads them across the empty hall.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Where’s the party, Slim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn the corner and enter. They stop in their tracks Bobby is hunched over on the couch; face down on the coff table. Blood pools under his face. Talia is sprawled across a nearby couch. Dead. Chuck lies motionless a few yards away. Also dead. Dimitri sits on the couch beside Bobby, smoking a cigar. Alexei stands close by as Iosif mans the exit.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: The party is over.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this, Dimitri?

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: You came here to do same thing, yes? I save you trouble. Trent fumbles.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: We came here to party. New girls, new guy, see? Heather is becoming an expert with the fake smiles. Dimit likes what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (to Ritchie) That’s Gwen’s husband. The cocksucker.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Pete set us up.  72. Dimitri gives Iosif a nod. Iosif steps forward and drives fist into Ritchie’s back, sending him to his knees. He grabs Nikki and drags her to Dimitri.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (fighting) Get off me!

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! Take it easy, Dimitri! Dimitri examines Nikki’s face.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: Where is my money?

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (butting in) What money?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I don’t have it. Ritchie gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I have the bag. All eyes on Ritchie.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Listen, Dimitri, whatever’s going on, it looks like you have everything under control here. So, we're just gonna get outta your hair and go party some place else, alright? Trent and Heather turn and get a face full of Iosif.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Tell Frankenstein to go easy on the girl and I’11 tell you where it is. Dimitri gives Iosif another nod. Iosif rushes over and knocks Ritchie out cold.  73. INT. IOSIF’S CAR/TRUNK - NIGHT MUFFLED RUSSIAN RAP MUSIC fills the darkness. Ritchie wakes up. His wrists are tied. He manages to get his phone. He turns it on to a “no signal” screen.
