The light illuminates the tight space. Bobby’s body is crammed in next to him, wrapped in plasti

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Hey! He kicks and screams until the music stops. The trunk opens. Alexei blocks the moonlight. He pulls Ritchie out. His phone goes flying in the struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re in the middle of nowhere. Darkness surrounds them A small cabin sits in the distance; the lights are on inside. AN OLD WOODEN SHED sits a few yards away from it. Alexei drags Ritchie by the car. Iosif sits on the hood. Headlights illuminate the ground. They pass Talia and Chuck, also wrapped in plastic, dead the dirt. A bit closer and Ritchie sees Nikki, chest deep in a hole shoveling. Alexei throws him to the ground. She’s excited to see him Makeup and sweat run down her face. She drops her shovel and claws at the edge of the hole to get closer.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: (whispering) We’re fucked, Ritchie. We’re so fucked.

dialogues.speaker: IOSIF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (thick Russian accent) Where is money? Ritchie gives Nikki a reassuring nod and gets to his feet  74.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: One last time... Let her go. A DEAFENING GUNSHOT rings out through the night air. Nikki collapses into a pile of dead weight and disappears Ritchie’s eyes go wild. He drops to his knees and reaches into the darkness after her, but only comes up with fistfuls of dirt. Dimitri emerges with a gun in his hand. Trent right behin him.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: A shame. She was very good digger. Ritchie turns quick, his eyes burning with rage. The goon stand by ready for anything. Dimitri hands Alexei the gun and he holsters it.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: (to Trent) Talk.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Trent circles around to Ritchie. He keeps his distance.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Listen, Ritchie... these guys are not negotiating. I know what they’re saying sounds a lot like questions but they’re really not asking. Just tell them where the money is. Heavy breathing comes from Ritchie but not one move.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: They’re gonna put you in that hole with her. Is that what you want?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Where’s Pete?  75.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: He’s on his way. Alexei and Iosif drag Talia and Chuck to the hole. They toss them in. Trent throws Dimitri a look before getting in a bit close

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (quiet) Pete said you have a kid in the hospital. Ritchie’s eyes go to Trent.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Do you want these guys to go see him? Because if I tell them, that’s exactly what they’1l do. They’11 go bring your boy back here and put him right there in that hole, too. Ritchie looks at Trent hard.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I’m waiting for Pete. Trent gives up and heads back to Dimitri.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: He’s waiting for Pete. Dimitri gives Alexei a nod. They drag Ritchie to the near shed. They toss him in like a rag doll and bolt the door behind them. The men walk to the cabin. Iosif stops and turns his car off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie sits up and tries to make out his surroundings. T shed is empty except for some buckets, a few empty crates and a beat-up bicycle. He bites at his restraints but the rope doesn’t give.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen looks like it hasn’t been touched since the seventies. The men take their seats at the table. Trent tries to comfort Heather. Alexei turns on a small radio and RUSSIAN RAP fills the room. Iosif takes Heather from the hand and leads her to the table.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: You dance, yes? She throws a concerned look at Trent and he throws her ba a reassuring nod. She climbs up onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: SHED
dialogues.text: Light comes shining through the shed’s wood planks. Ritch gets to his feet. He looks through the cracks. RITCHIE’S POV A car approaches. It stops. The door swings open. Pete steps out. He walks to the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather is giving the men a pretty good show. Pete enters. Trent jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Pete! What the fuck, man?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Sit down. Trent sits down. Heather stops dancing. Alexei turns down the radio.  Heather starts 77.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (to Dimitri) Tell me I didn’t come all the way to this shithole for a fucking bachelor party.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: (eyes on Heather) I make call to bosses. They are upset, but not surprised. (to Heather) Please, continue. shaking her stuff again.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: So we're good?

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: No, not good.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: What do you mean? I give you the assholes that blew your wife’s head off and you take care of Bobby. We’re all good. Alexei turns the music up again.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (to Pete) Dimitri noticed a big “bag ‘o’ cash” missing from his closet.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: How big?

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Two hundred and fifty Gs.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: The girl’s in the hole. Ritchie’s in the shed?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Where’s the shed?  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open. Pete stands in the doorway with Dimitri’s goons behind him. Ritchie sits in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Get him up! He storms out as they storm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie is dragged back to the hole.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Leave us. The goons go to the car. Ritchie can barely stand.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I need that money, Ritchie. Ritchie looks him in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I need a cigarette. Pete watches him carefully.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (to the goons) Hey! Do either of you meatheads smoke? “Sigareta”? Alexei approaches. He pulls out his pack and hands Pete a cigarette. Ritchie notices Alexei’s gun, holstered inside his jacket. Pete puts the cigarette in Ritchie’s mouth. Alexei lights it. He lights one for himself as he walks back to the car. Ritchie takes a huge drag. His bound hands come up and ta the cigarette from his lips. His wrists are badly bruised He brings them back down into the darkness and empties hi lungs into the mountain air.  79.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (RE: the hole) They killed her for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: She shot his wife.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Is that what you think? I think she wasn’t ready for that much blood. I think she got scared. Didn’t wanna go through it alone... looked for a friend. Ritchie is locked on the hole.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: It’s in my car.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Your car?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: In the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Are you lying to me? Ritchie takes another massive drag. Pete studies his face. He takes off toward the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (to the goons) Put him back. Iosif grabs Ritchie and pushes him back into the shed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door shuts behind him and the lock snaps shut. Ritchie presses his face to the cracks.  80. RITCHIE”S POV Pete motions to Iosif to get into his car. He mumbles something to Alexei who heads back inside. Pete gets into his car and drives off with Iosif.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE SHED
dialogues.text: Ritchie quickly turns around and produces the cigarette. holds it near his ropes and tries to get a burn going. He takes a few drags to keep the tip lit and goes to work on the fibers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather is down to her bra and panties. Alexei approaches and whispers into Dimitri’s ear. Trent looks on with a nervous gaze. Dimitri stands up and takes Heather’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: Come. We go now. Trent moves in as Dimitri helps Heather off the table.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Go where, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: To bedroom... for the sex.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: The sex? Dimitri, that’s my girl. You can’t just -- Alexei blocks his way. Dimitri and Heather disappear into the bedroom. The door closes behind them. Trent slumps back into his chair.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cigarette’s down to a roach. Sweat pours down Ritchie face. A few fibers begin to give. Slowly, one strand pops apart and that’s all it takes. Ritchie uses all his strength an tears himself free. He rubs his wrists and goes for the bicycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOANING comes from the bedroom. Trent exchanges looks wit Alexei. Alexei reaches over and turns up the RUSSIAN RAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is kicked into a cloud of splinters. Ritchie wal out with the bicycle’s chain wrapped tight around his fis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There’s a KNOCK at the door. Alexei gives Trent a pat on the back as he goes to it. He opens the door and... RITCHIE’S CHAINED FIST LANDS ON ALEXEI’S CHEEK LIKE A WRECKING BALL. His face is split open. He’s sent flying across the tiny kitchen. He crashes onto the table and doesn’t get up. Trent is already on his feet as Ritchie enters - bloodied and panting like a wild animal.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Ritchie! Thank God! We gotta get out of here! Ritchie drives his metal-clad fist deep into Trent’s skul He’s sent crashing through the bedroom door revealing Heather on the bed masturbating, and Dimitri sitting ina nearby chair with his pants around his ankles.  82.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Ritchie stomps in.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (to Dimitri) Don’t get up. With one swing, Dimitri is sent to the floor; blood spatters all over Heather. Ritchie picks him up and puts him back into his chair. Heather is hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (to Heather) Out. Heather gets the hell out of there. She hops over Trent. He crawl away after her. Ritchie undoes the chain from his bloody fist. Dimitri’s face is torn open. He barely clings to consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: It’s not your money anymore. Call your bosses. Straighten it out. We don’t see each other again, yes? Dimitri turns his bloody head to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: You are dead man. Your family... your friends... it is not cliché, it is promise. Ritchie looks tired and disappointed. He hurries to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Ritchie goes to Alexei. He pulls out the gun from inside his jacket. He makes sure it’s loaded.  83. Trent is half way across the kitchen now. Ritchie puts one round into the radio and shuts it up.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Ritchie jams the gun into Dimitri’s gaping cheek. Dimitri SHRIEKS .

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: We’re done, yes?

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: Fuck... you. Ritchie looks him in the eyes. Blood pours from his face and all over the gun. Ritchie hesitates, but finally PULL THE TRIGGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trent is inches from the exit. Ritchie stops to put a bullet in Alexei’s head. He walks across the torn up kitchen and gets to Trent. Trent’s face is barely holding together as he scratches a the doorstep. Ritchie pushes his head to the floor with the tip of his gun. One shot paints the welcome mat red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie approaches the hole. He goes to Iosif’s car and turns the headlights on. He looks down at the hole but sees only darkness. He drops to his knees and reaches down into it. He grabs anything for a while before finally finding something. He steadies himself, and with one hard pull, he drags Nik out of the hole. He wipes the hair and dirt from her face; she’s still beautiful, even in death.  84. INT. IOSIF’S CAR Ritchie carefully props Nikki up in the back seat. He get in the front. He looks at her through the rearview mirror. She almost looks like she’s sleeping. Ritchie turns the key and the engine roars to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAR CRASHES THROUGH THE DOOR and stalls in the middle of the kitchen. Ritchie stumbles out and goes to Alexei. He looks through his pockets and comes up with his lighter. He grabs Heather’s discarded dress and heads to the back the car. He unscrews the gas tank and shoves the dress deep into t hole. He takes one last look at Nikki. He flicks the lighter and lights it up. INT. TRENT’S MERCEDES Ritchie drops into the driver’s seat and starts up the engine. The car takes off like a rocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole place goes up in A HUGE FIREBALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mercedes cuts through the dark countryside. The tires scream with every curve.  85. INT. TRENT’S MERCEDES - NIGHT - TRAVELING Ritchie looks up ahead and sees Heather in his headlights Her bare skin glows as he approaches. She stumbles out of the way and disappears in his rearview. INT. PETE’S CAR - NIGHT - TRAVELING Pete and Iosif cruise in silence. Suddenly, light shines through Pete’s mirror and into his eyes. He squints at the approaching headlights.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Look at this prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RITCHIE PLOWS TRENT’S MERCEDES INTO PETE’S CAR. It swerve off the road and straight into a tree. The Mercedes grinds to a stop. Ritchie gets out. He holds his gun tight as he approaches the wreck. Smoke and fluids spew out of the demolished ca There’s broken glass and pieces of engine everywhere. Iosif lays face down a few feet from the mess. Ritchie quickly fires a shot into him as he passes. He slowly approaches the driver’s side. Pete’s face is glued to the steering wheel. He pulls him back against the seat and searches through h pockets...

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (groggy) Ritchie? Ritchie ignores him and keeps searching. Pete’s face is covered in blood. Ritchie finds his gun and shoves it int the back of his pants. He continues searching Pete’s pockets.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Ritchie?  86.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (searching) You got blood in your eyes, asshole. Ritchie comes up with nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You gotta get me out of here, Ritchie... I don’t feel right. Ritchie watches him struggle.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: I’1l help you, Pete... but you have to do something for me first. You know the drill.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Anything you want... name it.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: When you see the Devil... Ritchie points the gun at Pete’s forehead. Pete can’t see it through the blood.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: ...tell him we're even. BANG! He tosses the gun and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road is hard on Heather’s bare feet. She staggers dow the dark road with nothing but her earrings on. A light comes up from the horizon. A car quickly approaches. She tries desperately to flag it down, but th beat-up Mercedes speeds by her again. Her arms drop to her sides. The car disappears. EXT. TRENT’S MERCEDES - NIGHT - TRAVELING The bumper dangles from a thread. Only one headlight illuminates the road.  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flames continue to engulf the building. Ritchie pulls up. He gets out and hurries towards the blaze. He searches the ground where the car was parked. The flam pick up something shiny a few feet away - his phone. He picks it up and heads back to the mangled Mercedes. He takes one last look at the raging fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather shuffles across the middle of the road like a nak zombie. A lonely headlight appears in the distance and gets close She doesn’t even bother to look this time. The Mercedes comes to a stop behind her. She turns and se Ritchie at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mercedes struggles past empty streets. EXT. “PINK MONKEY STUDIOS” /PARKING LOT - NIGHT Ritchie barely manages to park it before the engine dies. sign hangs over the spot that reads: “TRENT ROTHSTEIN - PRODUCER” . INT. TRENT’S MERCEDES Ritchie pulls the keys from the ignition and hands them t Heather. She has his suit jacket draped over her shoulder

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: One of those should get you into the office. You can get some clothes, get cleaned up. Ritchie leaves her in the jalopy.  88. EXT. “PINK MONKEY STUDIOS” /STREET - NIGHT Ritchie’s car is right where he left it. He pops open the trunk and takes out the duffel bag. He opens it up and pulls out Nikki’s gun. He pulls his from his pants and shoves it in the bag. INT. RITCHIE’S CAR He tosses in the bag and gets behind the wheel. His phone BUZZES and startles him. He checks the screen and answers it quick.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over phone, filtered) Mr. Boland? EXT. “PINK MONKEY STUDIO’ S” /ENTRANCE Heather fumbles with the keys to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! She turns and sees Ritchie in his car. She approaches. Ritchie hands her Nikki’s gun. He speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie turns the corner, duffel bag in hand. The nurse greets him with a smile. It quickly fades as he approaches; he’s covered in blood and dirt.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  89. He looks like he’s been through Hell and back.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Peachee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie scrubs his hands vigorously. Blood and dirt circl the drain. He washes his face and neck and gets as much o the night off of him as he can. He grabs some clean scrubs. He puts them on and turns to find two NIGHTSHIFT NURSES staring at him. He picks up hi bag and walks past rows of incubators and finally gets to his boy.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (whispering) Hey, Buddy. The little guy opens his eyes and looks up at him. Ritchie’s eyes tear up.

dialogues.speaker: GRISWALT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Boland? Ritchie’s moment is cut short. He turns around to find SERGEANT GRISWALT, early 50’s, standing behind him with OFFICER LEE, mid 30’s, in uniform, close by.

dialogues.speaker: GRISWALT
dialogues.text: Richard Boland? The nurse pops up from behind them.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: (to Ritchie) That was blood on your clothes... I’m sorry.  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medical charts and posters cover the walls. Griswalt sits on the desk while Officer Lee stands near the door. Ritch is slumped in the chair between them, the duffel at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: GRISWALT
dialogues.text: You going on a trip? Ritchie looks over at Officer Lee by the door.

dialogues.speaker: GRISWALT
dialogues.text: Do you know where Detective Peter Sommersed is, Ritchie? Ritchie doesn’t answer. Griswalt looks over at Lee before reaching into his jacke He pulls out Nikki’s phone and sets it down on the desk. Ritchie focuses on it.

dialogues.speaker: GRISWALT
dialogues.text: He said you might show up here if things went south at the cabin. Told me to hold you down until he showed up. But he’s not answering his phone. He has Ritchie’s attention now.

dialogues.speaker: GRISWALT
dialogues.text: Detective Sommersed was involved in a multitude of illegal activities including blackmail, robbery, drug dealing and murder. You know why I used the past tense, right? Griswalt picks up the phone and approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: GRISWALT
dialogues.text: About an hour ago, Detective Peter Sommersed... was found wrapped around a tree, in the middle of nowhere, like some early Christmas present.  91. He stops in front of Ritchie.

dialogues.speaker: GRISWALT
dialogues.text: (beat) He won’t be missed. He tosses Ritchie the phone.

dialogues.speaker: GRISWALT
dialogues.text: My new promotion’s got me ina giddy mood, so I’m gonna give you a few days before coming after you. I suggest you use them wisely and get the hell out of Dodge ASA-fucking-P. Griswalt joins Lee at the door.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: What about the Russians?

dialogues.speaker: GRISWALT
dialogues.text: Last I heard the place is still burning. They’re not gonna find anything out there but ashes.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: You’re just gonna let me walk? Griswalt casually approaches with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: GRISWALT
dialogues.text: Time can bury a lot of things, Ritchie. But some things... you gotta bury yourself. They exit. Ritchie looks down at Nikki’s phone. The screen flashes “battery low”. He drops it in the trash. He grabs his bag and heads down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time, a smile appears on Ritchie’s face. Hi strides get more confident as he heads back to the nurser Suddenly, A LOUD VOICE BLARES OVER THE PA SYSTEM.  92.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (over PA, filtered) Code Pink! Code Pink! Ritchie’s smile is history. Nurses and orderlies rush past him down the hall. They burst through the nursery’s entrance. A BEAUTIFUL ANGELIC VOICE pierces through the chaos and drowns out all the sound - A CHOIR SINGER belts out a haunting hymn as Ritchie approaches the nursery’s open doorway. The medical staff struggles to resuscitate his boy. THE VOICE HITS ITS HIGHEST NOTE as the heart monitor flat lines. All emotion drains out of Ritchie’s face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cavernous altar, lit up only by candles. A CHOIR is in the middle of a practice. The angelic voice continues to engulf all the world’s sound. It belongs to A BEAUTIFUL YOUNG GIRL at the front the group. A few parishioners are spread out in the pews. Ritchie sits way in the back row. His trademark frown planted firmly back on his face; his hand on the duffel b beside him. He’s motionless, lost in thought, watching, but not focused. A priest emerges from a confessional and greets one of th parishioners. The girl’s voice fights to get into Ritchie’s heart, but suddenly gives up. Silence. Ritchie snaps out of his trance. He looks down at the bag and slowly takes away his hand.  93. He gets up. The priest spots him. Ritchie walks out. The duffel stays behind. The priest approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie stands in the cool morning air. He lights a cigarette and takes the smoke deep into his lungs. POLICE SIRENS in the distance. CAR HORNS and the YELLS of drivers in the throws of road-rage mix with jumbled MUSIC and a ton of INDISCERNIBLE CITY NOISE. Ritchie takes it all in. The chaos speaks to him.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: (sotto) Shit. He flicks his cigarette away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest has the duffel open. His eyes wide at the sigh of the cash inside.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Praise the lord. A hand reaches in and quickly cuts his moment short. The priest jumps back as Ritchie takes the bag. He even fights to let go for a second; joy replaced with shock.

dialogues.speaker: RITCHIE
dialogues.text: Sorry, father. Forgot my bag. Ritchie exits and leaves the priest standing there, speechless.  94. EXT. RITCHIE’S CAR Ritchie tosses the bag into his car before dropping into the driver’s seat. He starts it up fast and peels out eve faster. He disappears into the chaos. FADE OUT.
